line.en: A day of summer vacation.
It's been a while since we've been to school.
Today is registration day.
For the first time in two weeks, everyone in the\nclassroom is catching up on the latest news.
'Minase, you just said you're dating Habane?!\nSeriously?'
'Well, it happened kinda suddenly. It started\nwith small talk, you know, 'it's been a while,\nhow've you been doing?''
'You talked about things like that?'
'Jesus.'
'Crap. I've been trying to get close to her,\ntoo.'
'That's too bad. So, where did you get your\ninformation?'
'The girls over there are all gossiping.'
Meanwhile, on the other side of the classroom.
'No way!? You've started dating Minase?'
'...Gulp'
'Aah! I knew it. You guys got on great together.'
'Well, it remains a legend. It's so unfortunate\nthat it wasn't recorded.'
'What kind of confession was it?'
'His love of the sky.'
'Hey, hey, hey! What kind of rumors are you\nspreading?!'
'What did you say? Aoi's legend?'
'Involuntarily created... Come on, Kotori, stop\nalready.'
'No... I wanted to boast some.'
'They're made for each other.'
'I mean, look, they haven't really even started\ndating yet.'
The conversation continued without bad feelings.
'(I'm embarrassed ok, please cut it out\nalready.)'
'(Uh-huh, but silence creates more rumors,\ndoesn't it?)'
In our sophomore year, Kotori was very\nbad-mannered.
Though the number of our mutual friends\nincreased, there were still enough girls to hold\na grudge.
I wanted to stop any strange rumors before they\nstarted.
'(But there's no need to stop them while they\nspeak of my legend, right?)'
'You would think like that, wouldn't you?'
I know it's only a simple amusement.
Kotori, however, didn't seem all that amused\nsince these things were more difficult for her to\ntalk about.
'So, when did you start dating?'
'You live in the same dorm as us don't you? How\nabout that?'
Kotori was overcome by questions.
Uh, it's a...
'(I wonder if Habane-san is here?)'
The student council president came into our\nclassroom.
'Good morning, student council president.'
'Good morning, Aoi Minase.'
'Good morning student council president. Do you\nhave anything for me?'
'I was thinking I wanted to check in on Soaring\nClub's activities. You guys are not having\nactivities on campus, right?'
Kumoi-san gave us her approval and stood against\nthe faculty on our behalf.
The homeroom teacher seems to be with us, as\nwell.

'Thanks to finding a new location, we have
managed to finish improvements to the glider's
main body. We even managed to have a test flight,
too!'
As Kotori mentioned the 'test flight', the girls\nin the back started whispering things like 'the\nplace where legends are born.
So it seems that this will be the joke for the\ntime being.
'Wow, I'm impressed. What else should I expect\nfrom a club with motivation, compared to a club\nthat doesn't.'
'Thanks to you, Kumoi-san. Really, thanks so\nmuch!'
'Here is a club with motivation, though a\nsomewhat strange one.'
'Would it be alright if I saw a test flight?'
'Sure, of course! Come on by...'
Kumoi-san smiled at seeing Kotori full of\nconfidence.
'I'm looking forward to it.'
Just because it's registration day, and we're\nseeing all of the regular students again, that\ndoesn't mean that we are having class.
The homeroom teacher reminded us that we're on\nsummer break, and that we should leave.
The students not belonging to a dorm couldn't\nleave, though.
'Ageha, are you heading straight home after\nthis?'
'Yeah. We have a package coming today, and the\nfront desk can't sign for it.'
We, meaning 'the club'.
My destination was our secret base.
'Council president wasn't surprised at all.'
Kotori was in a great mood since Kumoi-san\npromised she would come take a look sometime.
How could you resist being prideful about a\nglider you helped to build?
While thinking about this, I go wait in front of\nthe elevator.
'Ah!'
Ageha cried out against her will and quickly shut\nher mouth.
From across the hallway, a heavy middle aged\nteacher came lumbering down.
'Huh?'
'Cheh... Tobioka.'
When Tobioka saw us, a sarcastic smile crossed\nhis mouth.
'Hey, you guys. When you see a teacher shouldn't\nyou greet them?'
'S-sorry Tobioka-sensei.'
When Ageha greeted the founder of the robot club,\nI lowered my head, too.
Only Kotori's expression said, 'Why would I greet\nyou?' just like a dog would greet a burglar.
'So it seems that you guys are participating in\nclub activities off-campus without the schools\npermission.'
'We got permission. We have acknowledgement from\nthe student council.'
'The Student Council? A simple gathering of\nchildren, and a pitiful excuse for a school\nbody.'
'We would be fine even without permission.'
Kotori muttered to herself, just loud enough for\nTobioka to hear.
Tobioka frowned with disapproval.
'If activities are off-campus and unrelated to\nschool, why should a teacher care?'
I finally snapped, too.
Tobioka glared at me with his usual pout .

'Well, then there is the matter of a stolen
glider from the warehouse. If it was used by
activities unrelated to school, then it was taken
by a thief, and criminals must be punished.'
'Ulgh...'
Hit where it hurt.
'Huuw, that at least might cause some problems.\nWatch yourselves.'
With his parting threat, Tobioka continued\nlumbering down the hall.
'Ooooooh! That jerk!'
'There's no doubt about that. Don't let him get\nto you.'
'Sure, but...!'
'If there any enemies to be had, it would be that\nguy.'
'Let's just get through summer break without\nmaking a fuss.'
'... Exactly. Let's let nothing be a hindrance\ntowards our goal of flying with a Morning Glory.'
As she spoke, Kotori settled down.
'Hurry up and come, already!' I muttered\nimpatiently while repeatedly pounding the\nelevator button.
Finally, the elevator arrived. The door opened\nand the passengers left the elevator.
We made space.
'Eh? You guys? Good morning.'
'Amane?!'
'I- I'm shocked! What are you doing riding the\nelevator?'
'Aheh. Actually, what are you guys doing in the\nelevator? '
'And it's not Amane to you. It's\nMochizuki-sensei.'
She said with a prideful swagger.
'Despite everything last year, I wanted to\ncontinue...'
'Mochizuki-sensei, what do you want?'
'Isn't she going to be a lecturer over the second\nsemester?'
'It's all business now. What can I say, I'm an\nadult.'
She stated with her nose in the air.
As usual, the statement was to give het the\nchance to boast.
'If she wants to become an adult that much, then\nshe should hurry up and graduate.'
'Oooh! You said it.'
'See ya, guys. I'll swing by the secret base\nlater.'
Amane strode down the hall.
The students who knew Amane made a face like\n'What's that?!' as they saw her go by.
'So, Amane's back at school. It's kinda\nstrange...'
'Oh, cool! I wanna become a special lecturer\ntoo!'
'So shouldn't you just put your dream out there?'
The appearance of Amane suddenly cast away the\nanger and bad taste left from meeting Tobioka.
'Ok, I gotta go. If I don't hurry I'm gonna miss\nthe mail.'
'Alright. Catch ya later!'
Ageha hurriedly ran home.
'So, shall we take our time heading out?'
I took Kotori's wheelchair handles and gazed\nabout.
There seemed to be few students heading home, but\nthere was still a strange life to the air.
Being at school during the summer holiday always\nmade things feel special.
While pushing Kotori's wheelchair, we made for\nhome.
'...How have you been since then?'
'How have I been?'
'You know... that time, some blood came out.'
'Ah...ah ah...yea...I'm fine.'
Kotori blushed and her cast her head down as she\nreplied.
'It hurt for a while, but it's gone now...'
'I see.'
Since our first time, it's been awkward facing\neach other or talking about this kind of stuff\nwhen others are around.
'...It hurt but, I was happy. That I was able to\ngive you my first.'
'Y-yeah. Me too.'
I replied shyly.
It's times like these when I'm glad to be behind\nKotori, where I don't have to show my face.
Several seconds of silence.
'A-anyway, let's go.'
I pushed the wheelchair again and we moved\nforward.
'Well? How is the seat?'
'It's good. I can just squeeze into here.'
Kotori said nervously, sitting in the cockpit.
Kotori checked the seat designed for her.
We're finally finished!
Is what I wanted to say, but...
'Boo... I can't believe the manufacturer gave us\nthe wrong parts...'
The package that Ageha ran home to collect ended\nup having the wrong parts. The manufacturer made\na mistake.
Thanks to the mishap, Kotori's cockpit was\nincomplete.
'After re-shipping, it should be here tomorrow at\nthe earliest.'
'So, the earliest we can run some tests is the\nday after tomorrow.'
Hearing the conversation, Kotori played with the\nyoke nervously.
'That yoke works... this rudder.'
In Kotori's cockpit there were no peddles. In\naddition to the yoke, there was an unfamiliar\nlever.
'So, how was it?'
'I can't exactly say... It was... good, but...'
Kotori seemed somewhat apologetic.
'The front seat worked?'
Kotori's cockpit took up two spaces.
Ageha looked over at me. I should explain.
'Don't worry about it. This cockpit isn't\nexclusively for Kotori's use.'
Just because the rudder is hand operated doesn't\nmean that someone else can't use it.
'Anyways, didn't you want to fly from the front\nseat?'
'Of course!'
Kotori curbed the excitement in her voice. Like a\nchild at Christmas she gazed at the yoke.
The desire to fly soon oozed from her body.
'I'm sorry, but you're going to have to wait just\na little bit longer.'
We're short some parts... There's nothing we can\ndo about that.
'So what you're saying is, until the gliders\ncomplete, there's no test.'
'Pretty much.'
Kotori was helped out of the cockpit and\ntransferred to her wheelchair, but her excitement\ndidn't cool down.
'You can work it properly, right?'
Amane came by after Kotori got out of the cockpit\nand stuck her head inside.
'You could at least say 'Hi' when you get here.'
Amane chattered as she checked out the cockpit\nthat she designed.
'Hey, Amane.'
'Hmph...'
'Amane, can you fly?'
'Huh? M-me?'
I tapped on Asa's shoulder. Amane looked up.
'Wha-?'
Kotori stopped by Amane.
'Amane, could you try and lean down some?'
Amane, was reluctant and cautious.
She looked like she wanted to avoid being slapped\non the head.
'It's ok, hurry up.'
Amane leaned down. Kotori reached out both hands.
Gyaa-
'Aaaah.'
And hugged Amane.
'Thank you Amane! You drew these blueprints for\nmy sake!'
With the strength of a Yukari tree, Kotori hugged\nAmane and swung her side to side.
'Aa aah! That hurts, Kotori!'
'I like you Amane!!'
Kotori did not let go of Amane until she was\nsatisfied transmitting her happiness.
'Thank you, everyone! You guys are the best of\nfriends!'
Kotori, wearing a grandiose expression, was so\nfilled with emotion she looked like she was about\nto cry.
'On the next test we're going to fly without\ndelay!'
Kotori turned solemn and nodded.
'Crap, I'm late.'
Since club activities were over, and it had been\na while since I had been home to see my family, I\ndecided to head home. I called my mom as I went.
My job was taking care of the dorm, so it was\nnice to get out and visit with my family\nsometimes.
I have to get home quickly to start getting\ndinner ready.
'I'm home!'
'Aah!'
When I got in the entranceway, Asa pointed at me\nand stated.
'Kotori-i!'
'What is it?'
'Kotori! Kotori!'
'What is it Asa?'
'Aoi came home.'
'Humph.'
'Geez, what was that all about?'
Tilting her head, Kotori made her way down the\nhallway in her wheelchair.
'Aoi!'
With body throwing-force, Kotori flew by, and at\nthe last minute braked to a stop and grabbed my\nhand.
'Aoi! Aoi! A-o-i!!!'
'What?! What's wrong?'
Hearing her name, Asa stepped forward.
'Kotori is looking forward to the test so much\nthat she can't stop fidgeting.'
'Only you can hope to appease her heart.'
'There was only an hour left, so I bravely went\nhome.'
'... (Moment by moment.)'
'So that was it. Sorry I'm late.'
But, why did you tell Asa?
'Here you go! A present!'
A 6 pack of Hargen Darch!
'Ooh!'
'There's some for Asa, too.'
I got them from my mother.
'Is it OK to eat them before dinner?'
'Sure, of course. Though you'll probably end up\neating dinner a little late.'
'Hmpha, hmmmph. Delicious!'
'Eating before dinner is so un-virtuous, yet I\ncan't help myself.'
'Hey, Yoru. Take half.'
'Thanks, Asa.'
The friends ate Hargen Darch together.
I didn't see Kanako, and wondered where she\ndisappeared off to.
'Hey, Kotori. Do you have any plans for\ntomorrow?'
We can't do any tests tomorrow, and due to the\nmishap with the parts, we can't do any work, so I\nguess tomorrow is a day off.
Kotori shook her head as she ate her ice cream.
'Right. Ok. So, do you want to go see a movie?'
'A movie?'
'Yeah, my mom gave me some tickets. If you\nwanted, I was thinking we could go together.'
She got them from a customer, so they're just\nregular tickets.
She gave them to me as a reward for working hard.
'Asa, Asa.'
Kotori called out Asa's name. Asa stepped forward\nand started whispering.
'Kotori! That was Aoi asking you out on a date\nwasn't it!'
'D-date?!'
'(I think it would be good if you went.)'
'(Yeah, but a movie...)'
'You don't like movies?'
Even though they were talking in whispers it was\npossible to hear their conversation.
'No, that's not it. I want to see the movie, and\nwith Aoi...'
Kotori stopped eating her ice cream and began\npondering.
'You don't need to worry.'
'Huh?'
'The theater is at Windy, and it's completely\nhandicap friendly there.'
Kotori's expression said, 'How did you manage to\nknow what I was thinking?
'Alright, I guess it's OK.'
'So it's decided.'
'That's excellent, Kotori!'
Asa said to a laughing Kotori.
'Well, I have start getting dinner ready. Could\nyou give me a hand when you finish eating?'
Kotori nodded and ate faster.
The next day.
Morning.
'Sorry to keep you waiting.'
I had a few last things I had to take care of\nbefore I joined Kotori, who was waiting at the\nentranceway.
'Humph.'
'What's wrong?'
'...Nothing, but you're always dressed\ndifferently.'
Feigning innocence, I answered, 'Oh really' as I\nlooked at my figure.
To be honest, I was kinda dressed up.
Today we are going on our first real date.
We've gone walking and shopping together, but\nwe've never really spent time alone together.\nJust the two of us.
So I decided I would like to dress a little nicer\nthan usual.
While Kotori grumbled a 'sure,' she looked at her\nown figure.
'...Hmmm, I think I want to change my clothes,\ntoo.'
'Isn't what you're wearing fine? You look good,\nand it suits you.'
'That, and we have to consider movie times.'
Kotori nodded, knowing there really wasn't time.
'Alright, Hat! We're heading out. Take care of\nthe place!'
'Quack...'
When Hat flew off Kotori's knees, I took her\nwheelchair and pushed it out the door.
'Wow, what a crowd.'
It's Sunday, which is typically everyone's day\noff, so Windy is especially crowded.
You could feel the weight of the crowds.
'This place is classy...'
Windy catered towards fashion with more than just\nthe design of the buildings.
All of the people coming and going were dressed\nup.

Since An-chan brought me here, I have been coming
to Windy regularly to see the various shops aside
from the underground shopping center which sold
foodstuffs.
When I came with An-chan, it was rather quiet and\ncalm. Those days seem to be the exception, not\nthe norm.
This isn't the casual laid back feeling of my\nhometown.
'Kotori, you grew up in Tokyo, right? So you're\nused to places like this?'
I imagine there are many shopping malls like this\nin Tokyo.
'My mother and sister would go... I've visited\nthem too, but... It's been a while.'
'B-but... It's amazing being here on a date!'
'Right?'
There's no doubt about it, it isn't an every day\nsort of thing.
For us, living in the dorm and always seeing the\nsame faces, this kind of place gives a fresh\nfeeling.
'My first date ever... This should be special.'
Kotori mumbled.
'Is that so? I figured you would have at least\nhad the experience of a date.'
Kotori shook her head.
'This is the first. With you, Aoi.'
'I am surprised we're having our first after\nwe've had our 'first'.'
'...I'm sorry.'
Kotori looked down on her dress.
'I knew it. I should have put on better clothes.'
'What's wrong with what you usually have?'
'I just feel shy.'
'But it's fine, since you are the only guy I want\nto please.'
'Like I said, it suits you. Come on, let's go see\nthe movie.'
'OK.'
As Japan's leading commercial complex, Windy also\nhad a cinema.
There were a variety of themed movies playing\nright now. The tickets I got were good for any of\nthem.
'Which one do you want to see?'
'Hmmm. Uh... Let's see. This one!'
Surpringly, Kotori chose a war movie.
She was probably attracted to the propeller on\nthe movie poster.
It took place in WWII Europe. It was a love story\nof an air force ace pilot.
The movie wasn't bad, but it didn't matter so\nmuch on a date.

Kotori was excited at the fight scenes, and
bubbly at the love scenes. In the end, the movie
delivered the warm, fuzzy feelings of a happy
ending.
'That was awesome!! The air battle at the end was\nunbelievably cool.'
'The lovers flying during a nighttime date was\nalso unbelievable romantic.'
Even after the movie was finished, Kotori's\nenthusiasm did not lessen.
'Those types of old fashioned planes are\ninteresting, aren't they?'
'Yeah, but those flying engines are kinda\nstrange.'
I wouldn't exactly say strange, but the way the\nthose planes fly and the way a glider flies are\ndifferent, as we saw in the movie.
'So, do you think there's a place that sells\ngoggles around here? I think they're absolutely\nnecessary.'
'Not at all. Did you plan to use them during the\ntest flight?'
Kotori nodded.
'Well, you don't need them. After all, the glider\nhas a canopy.'
During flight, the canopy is shut.
If it were to open, then you would completely\nlose control of the glider, and you would forced\nto use a parachute.
'Well, we need to take care of our stomachs, too.\nHow about lunch?'
'You have to let me pay for that!'
'What's this all of a sudden?'
'Because you treated me to the movie.'
'But I told you, my mother gave me those\ntickets.'
I had a free ticket too.
'Sure... But...'
'At least let me treat you to lunch. I don't\nexactly have the chance to do a lot of\nboyfriend-like stuff.'
We only just started dating, so up until now\nthere hasn't been any significant change in our\nrelationship.
Even before we started dating, we were always\ngood friends.
The only difference is that now we've confessed\nour true feelings for each other.
Well, and a few other things...like kissing.
'It's not like that at all. Aoi, you have always\nbeen boyfriend-like.'
'You're cool and kind. You're too perfect.'
'You think so?'
'I said so didn't I? So There's no doubt about\nit.'
Kotori stated convincing pride.
As usual, Kotori has a lot of self confidence.
'But, let me treat you to lunch. I get an\nallowance for working at the dorm.'
'O-Ok. Sure.'
'So, what do you want to eat?'
'Hmm. Let's see...'
Kotori opened the map.
Kotori chose a restaurant that fit in with the\nchic style of Windy.
'Here's good.'
'Which one? Seriously?!'
Kotori said 'yes,' as she nodded insistently.
Taiyoken \ Old man Masaki's ramen shop.
'I, uh well, I've never had ramen.'
'Is it something to be 'that' surprised about?'
'No, it's uh...'
Ramen could be considered a national favorite,\nlike beef bowls and curry rice.
'Whenever my family went out, no one ever said\nanything about ramen.'
A sign that Kotori's family was somewhat well\noff.
Her father was the gentleman type, who would even\nwear suits over summer vacation.
'Alright, should we go to Taiyoken then?'
'Let's do it.'
And so we headed towards Taiyoken.
'I'm done ô That was delicious, Aoi. Thank you!'
Kotori said as she pats her stomach in\nsatisfaction.
'You're welcome.'
It somewhat ruined the sense of being perfect,\nbut I was still quite pleased.
Besides, this was probably cheaper.
I introduced Kotori to Mr. Masaki, who then gave\nus massive discounts, making the meal practically\nfree.
'Tonkotsu ramen is pretty rich, but I think I\nwould like to eat it again some time.'
'We can come anytime. Mr. Masaki will probably\ngive discounts again too.'
Kotori is my girlfriend, and she's cute, so we\nreceived a warm welcome.
'You're like a son to him. He's a nice old man.'
With full, satisfied stomachs, we wandered\nthrough Windy.
There were quite a lot of different kinds of\nshops.

Mostly they were woman's clothing and accessory
shops, but there were also shops that sold
tableware and miscellaneous goods, a bookstore, a
stationery shop, and strangely a dentist office.
Usually, I had no interest, and I wouldn't have\nhad any reason to go to places like this.
But today is different.
As we passed the woman's clothing shops, I looked\nat the clothes and caught my self thinking,\n'Kotori would probably look great in these.
'Say, Kotori. Those clothes... Kotori?'
For some reason, Kotori was frowning as she\nwatched another couple.
'What's with the gloomy face?'
'Huh, It's nothing. Nothing at all.'
Was she irritated at their clinginess?
No, we were on a date too.
'Hey, Aoi. Could you come here a sec?'
'Ooh.'
Kotori grabbed my hand.
And so, with one hand I began pushing the wheel\nof the wheelchair.
'H-hey!'
'Aha! Let's go faster!'
'So you just wanted to walk hand-in-hand.'
Generally couples hold hands, or link arms. Some\nsecretly place their hands on each other's lower\nbacks.
When I saw these things, it's not that I didn't\nfeel any jealousy, but...
'Hyo... Hyo...'
While I was holding Kotori's hand, I saw the look\nof surprise in the surrounding people's eyes.
From my perspective, pushing Kotori's wheelchair\none-handed was... Hmm... How can I put it...\nRather harsh.
'Stop! S-st-stop!'
'Haha... What?'
'You've started breathing heavier. Don't push\nyourself.'
'This isn't difficult. I'm always going between\nhome and school, so this is nothing at all.'
Compared to the average girl, Kotori certainly\nwas quite strong.
Windmill Hill is gently sloped, but climbing it\nis exhausting.
That said, it has to be next to impossible with a\nwheelchair.
'Just seeing you like this, it looks difficult\nand exhausting.'
I told her as I let go of her hand.
'But I can't see your face when you're behind\nme.'
'We waited forever for this date...'
It hurt to see Kotori feeling so downhearted.
'Alright, how about if we stand side by side?'
'...Sure.'
Satisfied with the solution, Kotori nodded.
I figured it must be difficult for Kotori to push\nherself, but I might be over-thinking it.
It's definitely better to see her face.
'If it becomes too difficult, say something ok?\nDon't overdo it.'
'I understand. Now, shut up.'
And so, side by side, we looked around Windy.
It wasn't that there was nowhere I wanted to go.\nWe were in no hurry, and we had plenty of time.
'(Ah... Those clothes are nice.)'
There was a pale blue dress hanging a shop\nwindow.
It was the color of the sky; I thought Kotori\nwould look good in it.
Kotori was absentmindedly looking at the same\nshop.
'Those clothes there. Do you like them?'
'Hum? It's not bad... I just glanced at it.'
'I think you would look good in them.'
I compared the dress with Kotori's refection in\nthe shop window.
Yes, It would without a doubt look good on her.
'Hmm... I wonder how it would look on me...'
Even though she was doubtful, she didn't seem to\nbe denying their possibility.
'I don't think you can try on the clothes.'
'Huh, ah... well... It's troublesome for the\nshopkeeper.'
I stuck my head into the shop and met the eyes of\na female shop attendant. She smiled at me.
'May I help you find anything?'
'We like this dress, but trying it on, and ...'
'Uh, no that's quite alright. Look, let's go.'
Kotori raised her voice as she grabbed her\nwheelchair wheel and sped out.
'H-hey! Wait!'
No sooner then I saw the back of the dress did\nKotori go flying out of the shop.
The shop attendant smiled and showed me out of\nthe shop.
'Gasp... 'Thump-thump'.'
'What did you run off for?'
'I-I told you that it would be bothersome to try\nthe dress.'
'You should have just said something.'
'Enough already. When it comes to clothing, my\nsister can get it for me.'
'You didn't like the dress?'
'It's not that, it's just, well. Uh, whatever.\nLet's go.'
Crap.
Kotori's lost all of her enthusiasm.
Our plan was to go see a movie, which we did... I\nwouldn't be surprised if Kotori started saying\nthat she wanted to go home.
'What do you want to do now? There seems to be a\narcade around here...'
We stopped and looked for something interesting\non the map.
'I think I might be a little tired. I want to\nrest somewhere.'
I was relieved that, despite her drop in\nenthusiasm, she didn't say that she wanted to go\nhome.
'Ok, let's see. Shall we check out over there?'
'Over there?'
Actually, there was a place I wanted to check out\nagain today.
'The shop that you wanted to see before.'
Kotori tilted her head.
'The place you said has the delicious looking\nMille feuille.'
Taking the hint, Kotori gasped.
'Cafe Flags.'
'Go to Cafe Flags.' \ this was on Kotori's 'to\ndo' list.
Cafe Flags was a famous pastry shop known for\ntheir deliciously sweet creations.
When Kotori added it her list she didn't realize\nthat it was also a dating hot spot.
Cafe Flags happened to be at Windy.
'But isn't that place expensive?'
'Don't worry about it, we've got plenty of money\nleft. Lunch was pretty inexpensive.'
'...So let's go, Kotori!'
'O-ooh!'
Outside Cafe Flags, a line had formed.
Just like we heard, it's a pretty popular store.
The people waiting were primarily young couples\nand older ladies hunched over with shopping bags.
'Wow, there are so many people.'
'The food must be really good.'
'We're getting in line...?'
'Of course.'
From where we stood, the wait was about 30\nminutes.
The customers who made reservations walked right\ninside.
When entering the cafe, the hostess called out\n'table seating one', and guided Kotori along.
'It's this kind of cafe then...'
Kotori muttered when she saw the sleek interior\ndesign.
I also looked around with curiosity.
We opened our menus.
'Oh geez! This place is expensive!'
The cheapest cakes are around 800 yen.
The tea is about the same, with the more\nexpensive teas over 1000 yen a cup.
And let's see, their featured mille-feuille cake\nis no less than 1300 yen a slice.
At these prices, there's no doubt that the food\nis exceptionally good.
No, I'm not angry!
With a tightening chest, I asked Kotori...
'What do you want?'
'Uh, let's see. The mille-feuille and a\nDarjeeling tea.'
'The mille-feuille and an ice tea sounds good.'
We called a waiter and placed an order.
'Finally, we can try the famed mille-feuille!'
'Yeah, I can't wait.'
It seems like she still isn't happy.
Surely over-thinking about everything has sent\nher mood into a downward spiral.
'I'm sorry about earlier.'
'Huh? What are you apologizing for?'
'I got your thoughts going into a bad place.'
'No, it's not that. There is nothing wrong with\nyou Aoi.'
'It's... normal stuff...'
Kotori stopped talking mid-sentence.
I didn't say anything. Kotori opened her mouth\nand paused.
Kotori nervously looked up at me.
'...Are you having a good time on this date with\nme?'
'Having a good time?'
What are you suddenly saying?
What are you suddenly trying to say?
'Thanks to me, don't we kind of stand out?'
As she spoke, her eyes looked about the room and\ncaught the glances of other customers.
'People sort of noticed us when we got here,\ntoo.'
'Does that sort of thing bother you?'
'I can't help thinking like this when I'm\ntogether with you.'
'The clothes, the not walking hand in hand...'
Kotori gradually sank into herself.
'You told me these clothes were cute just to\nflatter me right?'
'Yeah...'
'Look, you like me, right?'
Kotori nodded her head in acknowledgement.
'Well, my sister picked the clothes.'
That wasn't surprising. Hibari has good taste,\nand knows what looks good on Kotori.
However, the statement was not meant as a\npositive thing.
'I thought those clothes from earlier would look\ngood on you. You seemed to like them, too.'
'But don't you think it would be strange for a\ngirl like me to dress up?'
'I don't think it would be strange at all.'
'Yeah...?'
'You just said that thanks to you we stand out,\nright? That it's because of the wheelchair? I\ndon't think that's true at all.'
'Huh?'
'You're cute, so people are looking.'
'Wha-? No. I don't think so.'
'You can say that in spite of the fact that\npeople are always calling you a beautiful girl?'
'Eh, well...'
I can admit to that...
Kotori is cute.
It wouldn't be strange to call her beautiful.
That's why people can't help but look.
If there are people staring, it's because they\nsee a beautiful girl in a wheelchair, and they\nwonder what her story is.
Of course it makes Kotori feel uncomfortable, but\nthere's nothing that can be done about that.
'You're cute Kotori, so much that people turn to\nlook at you without thinking.'
'They think, 'Wow! If only I could date a girl\nlike that...''
Kotori let out a small laugh.
'Yes! You're even cuter when you laugh. After\nall, it's your natural, cool self.'
'Ok, Ok! Enough! I said forget about it! This\ntime remember that.'
'Hahaha, that was intense. I won't forget'
When you look back on this, you'll laugh.
I sat up straight, put on a relaxed,\nself-confident expression, and flicked the hair\nfrom my face.
I flicked the hair side to side.
I can't say anything when you're sitting there\nwith that self-confident air.
'That's not kind.'
When Kotori grumbled like that she unconsciously\ngot cuter. I restrained myself.
In stead, I held my hand out across the table.
Kotori picking up on my meaning and softly laid\nher hand in mine.
'Things like handholding... we can do when we're\nnot walking.'
'Besides, who else can have a date in a glider\nsoaring in the sky. Probably only us, right?'
Without a doubt, the other couples at Windy would\nbe jealous.
Kotori looked up at me.
'You're probably right.'
Kotori's mood seemed to brighten suddenly.
'So won't you laugh for me? When your smile\nshines, it makes you even more beautiful.'
'Ah, haha. Thank you Aoi.'
The waiter brought the tea and cakes while Kotori\nsmiled brightly.
Kotori pulled back her excited hand. The waiter\nsaw it and smiled softly.
The waiter placed the plates on the table.
'Ooooh!'
Kotori's eyes shone brightly when she saw the\nmille-feuille.
'You practically started drooling when you saw\nthat pastry.'
Kotori wiped her mouth hurriedly.
'(Slurp)... B-but, just look at this, this\nmille-feuille!'
Of course I'm looking at it! I have the same\nthing in front of me.
'Is this not the most divine aura? Surely it is\nabsolutely the most delicious looking pastry\never.'
'As expected from an international pastry,\n'Kotori muttered as she examined every corner of\nthe cake.

Just how many layers did this thing have? The
layers of crust were countless- never mind the
layers of strawberry and the deep colored
custard.
On top, there was a dollop of fresh cream with a\nstrawberry.
Over the strawberry, there was a transparent,\njelly-like, sauce that shone brightly like a\njewel under the shop's interior lighting.
The fact that Kotori stated it was absolutely\ndelicious before tasting it was natural.
'I knew it. When you're angry or feeling down,\nsweets are the answer.'
'No, no, no, it's not like that at all.'
Which is it?
'In any case, you seem to have cheered up. I'm\nglad.'
Kotori nodded brightly.
So this should be awkward, I thought.
'Hey, let's eat!'
Kotori nodded her head in reverent agreement.
'Gulp... Alright...'
With trembling hands, Kotori gripped her knife\nand fork and brought them to the mille-feuille.
It's crispy...
The knife cutting into the crust made a small,\ndelightful sound.
Kotori took a slice of strawberry and cream with\ncrust to her fork, and then carefully brought it\nto her lips.
'Yuuuum.'
'Deeeelicious!!!!'
Kotori brought her hand to her cheek and stated\nunconsciously.
Seeing Kotori, the waiter nodded, smiled, and\nsaid, 'Our customers often say that.'
'Ah... It's not too sweet... Not too sour... Its\nrich and profound flavor fills my mouth.'
'Umm... This is the taste of happiness.'
The cake seemed so delicious that even Kotori's\nway of speaking seemed to change.
'Let's see...'
Chomp.
'Chomp, chomp... Man, this really is good!'

At first the light sweetness and the sourness of
the strawberry came out, then the taste rounded
out as it mixed together with the perfect amount
of cream.
Then, if you could describe its taste with\ntexture, it tasted crispy.

Blending different textures and different types
of sweetness together into balance with each
other creates a refined, harmonious balance of
elegance.
Without exaggerating, I can say that before\neating this cake, one has never truly lived.
'(This cake is the kind of thing only meant to be\neaten on special occasions, like birthdays and\nChristmas.)'
Of all cakes that I've had, this was the one that\nembodies the concept of cake. ... No, it was an\nexperience.
'Happiness!'
While eating the cake, Kotori's heart seemed to\nexude happiness.
This constant success was almost more irritating\nthan it was encouraging..
This was completely different than when she\ncheered up from having Hargen Darch.
'This tea is also amazing. I'm think I'm in\nheaven.'
While lost in thought, Kotori reached under the\nwheelchair and rummaged about.
What she pulled out was Isuka's navigation log.
'Do you always carry that thing around with you?'
'It's important to me.'
The wheelchair was a regular wheelchair, so it\nwas natural that it received rough handling.
On rainy days, you have to quickly push yourself\nwith all your strength, then you have to fight\nwith the slopes of the hills.
When you were on the beach, you had to deal with\nsand and grit, and then, of course, occasionally\nfalling over.
Thanks to a new frame not coming in, the dent in\nthe wheelchair couldn't be fixed.
It was only natural that the journal, which had\nbeen there for it all, was a little tattered.
Kotori opened the journal like an old veteran.
She stopped on the page with the 'to do' list.
'Da-ta-da! One more 'to do', completed!'
It was more difficult than expected to fill in\nthat box.
Kotori gazed satisfactorily at the page for a\nmoment, but then her attention turned back\ntowards the pastry.
This time I saw.
Quickly.
'Munch... munch...?'
'Yes... This very well might be the peak of my\nlife.'
'Huh? What did you say?'
'I am going out with an amazingly wonderful guy,\nhave wonderful and reliable friends, and soon my\ndream of flying will come true.'
'This must be what they mean by bliss'
'What do you mean by that?'
'The idea of having real satisfaction in one's\nlife. I definitely couldn't ask for more right\nnow.'
Kotori stabbed a giant strawberry with her fork,\npunctuating her point.
'And this mille-feuille is so much more delicious\nsince you're here with me Aoi. Definitely.'
She made sounds of delight when she spoke.
As usual, Kotori might have gotten a little\ncarried away.
Whether feeling down or feeling great, my\ngirlfriend is unique.
'Alright. You can finish it after one thing.'
What's that?' Kotori asked as she looked up at\nme.
I pointed at the item at the top of the list, 'To\ncross a passage way of clouds' .
Isuka's left over item.
Kotori squirmed and ate some mille-feuille, then\ngazed down at the item.
'We can reach this dream too.'
A Morning Glory is supposed to appear by the end\nof summer.
We just have to wait a bit longer.
'You always take everyone's feelings into\nconsideration.'
'That's not that hard.'
'I was chosen as pilot because there was no one\nelse suitable.'
'But that might change when tomorrow comes.'
It was a little late, but it seemed like Kotori\nwanted to say something to me.
'No way! I don't think so! From now on I'm going\nto be practicing!'
'Last year I felt the same way when I was told I\nwould be the one to fly.'
When I think about it now, it was absurd.
It was actually dangerous.
'Aoi, don't you want to fly? A Morning Glory\nis...'
'I want to fly. I really, really want to.'
Everything was so close last year, there are so\nmany feelings that I cannot seem to forget.
'Alright, that settles it, Aoi, you are going to\nbe the pilot. There's no problem here.'
Kotori said calmly and gently as she took another\nbite of mille-feuille.
'While we're talking about strange things, wasn't\nyour heart pounding like crazy?'
As Kotori said this, her face turned red like the\nstrawberry.
'Thanks... You really think it's ok?'
'Yup, it's cool. You'll see.'
Kotori insists.
'Aoi, you always do things for other people, and\nthat's OK, but this time I want to help you.'
'Then let us not hesitate to devour this tasty\nfeast.'
I took care of the check, as Kotori finished her\nfood.
Though there were only the pastries and tea\nbetween the two of us, the check was a pretty\nsizable amount.
'Regardless, the mille-feuille was delicious.'
As I said this, the taste of the mille-feuille\nseemed to flood into Kotori's mouth and cause her\neyes to shine brightly.
'It was so amazingly delicious!'
'It makes sense that this place is so popular.\nI'll have to tell Hibari about it later.'
As she spoke, her words came out wildly; she was\ncompletely overjoyed.
'Now what do you want to do? Shall we get out of\nWindy and go somewhere a little quieter?'
While glancing at the map, Kotori answered, 'Uh,\nsure,' though she was evidently deep in thought.
If you made the roof out of glass, the sunlight\nwould flood from the sky.
While Kotori was concentrating, I peeked up at\nthe blue skies.
Looking at this beautiful weather makes me want\nto go flying.
'(Hmm, a good thermal seems to be forming around\nthose clouds over there...)'
While I was thinking about the forming thermals,\nI noticed that Kotori was watching me.
'Hmm? What's up?'
'Uh, um. Oh, nothing.'
'I just think that you're kinda cool.'
'...And just now as you were looking up at the\nsky, you were more than 'kinda' cool.'
'I see. Thanks.'
'I'm looking forward to seeing tomorrow's test.'
'Ye- yeah. I'll do my best.'
'Everyone has worked so hard for me and this\nproject.'
Kotori bobbed her head enthusiastically.
'So, have you picked a place you want to go?'
Oh yeah,' Kotori exclaimed as she looked back at\nthe map.
'Ah, let's see. I'd like to go check out the game\ncenter, but not yet... Something before that...'
Kotori muttered with some slight hesitation.
'...I think I'd like to try on that blue dress\nfrom before.'
Embarrassed, Kotori looked away for as she spoke.\nI quickly took turned Kotori's wheelchair around\nand pushed.
'Wo-woah.'
'Really! I really think it would look great on\nyou!'
'Whoa! Calm down, Aoi, we don't have to rush.'
'Come on! Let's go, Kotori!'
Before Kotori could change her mind, I rushed to\nthe store.
'Welcome home. You were on a date, right?'
Ageha was at Flying Fish Manor when we returned.
'Hey, why did you come back? You should hang out\nelsewhere on days when we don't have club\nmeetings.'
'It's OK, right? I can relax here.'
'How was it, Kotori?'
Asa grew impatient and drew closer to Kotori.
'... It was an absolute blast. The movie was\ngreat. For lunch we had the most delicious ramen,\nand then...'
'And then, what?'
'And then, well... Hmm...'
Kotori placed an important looking bag on the\ntable.
Ageha's eyes saw the brand logo on the bag and\nmade an expression that said 'Oh my.
'I know that shop... I went to buy some clothes\nthere. It's expensive, right?'
'No, not really.'
Ageha tilted her head with a puzzled expression.
'It was a gift.'
Kotori's faced beamed with a smile.
'Oh man! Wow!'
'I heard that!'
'See, here, check it out.'
'Wow, a dress! It's a nice color; I'm sure you\nlook great in it.'
'That's what Aoi said too, so he bought it for\nme. Ahem'
For some reason both Ageha and Yoru looked at me.
'R-right. I have to go clean the bathrooms,\nso...'
'Oh, if you're talking about the showers, Kanako\nis using them right now.'
'Alright, I'll go clean the entranceway.'
'But hey, after the movie we went to Cafe Flags\nand had mille feuille.'
I left zipped out of the dining hall, leaving\nKotori as she continued excitedly retelling our\ndate.
Morning...
Finally, today's the day.
'Quaaaaaaack...?'
'Good morning, Hat. It's still early, so you can\nsleep some more.'
'Quaaaaaaack...'
I got out of bed and changed clothes.
I made my way over to my wheelchair, which was by\nmy desk. Last night I pulled out my notebook...\nIsuka's notebook and looked over it.
From the day on I found this notebook, I began to\ngaze up at the sky.
Even then, I had a vague yearning to fly.
My name is 'Kotori,' which also means 'small\nbird.' I've had issues with my name since I was\nyoung.

I joined a ballet group. Every day, I would
practice jumping higher and higher, but it still
wasn't flying. I became very irritated with by
fact.
After the accident, when I lost the use of both\nlegs, this irritation became even stronger.
I felt like a bird whose wings had been pulled\noff.
Then, I found this notebook.
The notebook was actually a journal written by\nanother girl trying to find a way to fly.
The vague desire to fly turned into something\nmuch greater. I drew the silhouette of large\nwhite wings across my chest.
I wanted to try and fly too...
I was a finch, I said. I read and re-read this\nnotebook as if were a legendary tale.
Time and time again.
'Today's the day I've dreamed of for so long...'
That's what I think.
'I-I'm nervous and haven't been able to sleep\nwell.'
I blinked weakly.
'Kotori... are you awake?'
'If you don't wake up now, you're going to be\nlate.'
'Unnn... I'm awake... I'm going soon...'
'Ri-ght.'
'Hat, I'm heading out. You be good!'
'Quaaack!'
'It looks like today is going to be pretty hot\nagain.'
I complained at the sun.
The sky was clear with an occasional cloud and\nsome wind.
'Good. OK, this one is the yoke, and this the\nrudder. Don't mix them up.'
'This one... yoke. This one... rudder.'
Kotori with a meek expression repeated the\ninstructions.
'You shouldn't touch them until instructed.\nEspecially during take-off; it's unbelievably\ndangerous.'
'Yeah, got it.'
I was sitting behind Kotori so I could only see\nthe back of her head, but I think I could feel\nher nervousness.
'Kotori, Kotori...'
Amane stopped by.
She took the day off and came here.

Amane wanted not only to see the cockpit she
designed in action, but also to watch the test
flight to see if any further modifications needed
to be made.
'What is it Amane, I'm kind of busy right now.'
'Hahaha. What's wrong? A bit nervous, are we? The\nsky is a scary place, and it's so high, too!\nMuwaha.'
Amane was in extremely high spirits.
'When I was in your shoes, I just repeatedly\nwrote the character for 'person' and drank. That\nworked for me.'
Kotori glares at Amane.
'I'm just excited right now. If you're here to\nmake fun of me then get in the back!'
Amane likes to get even by teasing people back.

Back when Amane was scared of taking her test
flight, Kotori (with the hand that she wrote the
character for 'man' all over) slapped her in the
face.
People are bad, but this is surprising for Amane.
'If that's what you want, I'll lend it to you.'
Amane held out the charm Kotori gave her the\nother day to protect against traffic accidents.
'...Thanks Amane.'
'I think this arrangement works well.'
Asa who worked the winch system radioed.
'Alright. Are you ready? You have a date with the\nsky. Have fun!'
As they closed the canopy over us, I felt my\nnervousness grow.
We checked everything one last time and made for\ntakeoff.
From the backseat, I tried to catch a glimpse of\nKotori's mood.
She sat there nervously, itching to do something.
'Do you remember the procedures for takeoff?'
'I've practiced them on the simulator a thousand\ntimes.'
Amane's simulation software had a procedure for\ntake off and landings too.
Kotori's problem was with her legs, not with her\nmemory. I knew she was quite level headed, and\nthat she could remember all of the procedures.
'OK! Let's go!'
I gave Ageha that sign that we were ready.
Ageha then gave the final OK to Asa.
'Huaah-.'
The glider that Kotori and I were riding ran down\nthe runway.
In mere seconds, the enormous white wings spread\nopen, and we left the ground to soar high in the\nsky.
'We have been properly disengaged from the\ntowline, but you should physically turn and\nconfirm with your eyes.'
The winch that pulled the glider was attached to\na long rope, which connected to the bottom of the\nglider by hook.

When the disengagement lever is pulled, the hook
disconnects. If the glider does not properly
disconnect from the hook, then a major accident
can occur.

The winch is designed to have the glider pass
over it, at which point the hook will
automatically disconnect from the winch. It's a
system, but it isn't perfect.
'The towline has been disconnected.'
Kotori visually confirmed the falling parachute.
'Excellent, take off was a success. So today, for\nstarters, we are going to cover basic operation\nprinciples.'
'Alright!'
I explained the glider's basic operations to\nKotori.
From normal turning to quick turns, and important\npoints therein.
For normal glider flight, there were few\noperations that needed to be remembered.
The only complicated procedures are during\ntake-off and landing.
After that, there were spins, stalls, and other\nsteps necessary to avoid accidents.
If you can't keep a level head, then you can't do\nthe techniques. But for today, I just wanted to\nremind her to be cautious.
'Alright! Give it a try!'
'Ok! Turning counter-clockwise...'
Kotori squeezed the levers which operate the yoke\nand rudder.
Relaxed, I keep a hand on the yoke.
The glider banked to the left and started\nturning.
'We're sliding inwards. Apply more pressure to\nthe rudder.'
Kotori was applying enough pressure, but it was a\nhabit of mine to give a little more in this\ninstance.
Sliding inwards means that the nose is facing\noutwards of the side you are banking on.
Just now, the glider was banking left. When\nbanking left, the nose should face left as you\nmake the turn.
If you don't keep the nose of the glider in the\ndirection of travel, you will lose lift, and as a\nresult, your altitude will drop.
Kotori pulled back the lever which operated the\nrudder.
The nose of the plane faced inward.
When the glider gained equilibrium, it smoothly\nsailed left.
'You can clearly see the yaw string.'
The yaw string is like the tail of a worm\nattached to the front of the canopy that shows\nthe wind flow.
It is an extremely simple, but useful tool made\nfrom a length of woven wool.
'The yaw string is proof that the glider is\nturning left or right.'
With this single piece of thread the you can know\nwhether the glider is slipping to the outside or\ninside of a turn.
While turning, the yaw string should be spinning\nin perfect equilibrium.
'If the yaw string is curved, you apply pressure\nto the rudder, in the opposite direction.'
'Ok, let's turn counter-clockwise.'
'Alright!'
While checking the yaw string, Kotori operated\nthe yoke and rudder.
The glider sailed left. This time, turning\nsmoothly in equilibrium.
'Everyone, I brought ice cream. Come and get it!'
'Ah, Yoru certainly is thoughtful, isn't she.'
'Whoo! Ice cream!'
'So, how is it going?'
'Kotori is still flying. I'm not an expert or\nanything, but she seems to be doing really well\nfor her first time.'
'Kotori is amazing... 'chomp, chomp' She is even\nbetter than me... 'mutter, mutter''
'That girl has always had amazing motor control.\nAnd even more...'
'She spent a lot of time playing the simulator,\ntoo.'
'I know.'
'I kinda saw by accident. I wanted to know what\nwas going on, so I snuck into the secret base.'
'People don't see the hard-working Kotori like\nthis, but she is cool'
'That level of enthusiasm has to been\nembarrassing.'
'But, there is no doubt about it, Kotori is a\nhard working person.'
Kotori's aviation training continued.
Gradually, altitude was lost, though there was\nstill plenty of space to fly.
Kotori did a great job keeping altitude loss to a\nminimum.
Wheee...
The glider for an instant glided unsteadily\nwithout air.
'What was that just now?'
'It was probably a thermal. If we fly in those,\nwe can go higher.'
'Got it!'
Kotori flew the glider around and around\nsearching for good patches of air like they flew\nin before.
Whaaa!
Found one.
'Ah! A thermal!'
'That was the heart of the thermal. When you find\none of those, you should use as small of a\nturning radius as possible.'
Kotori flew in a lazy figure 8 pattern as she\nsearched for the heart of the thermal.
Suddenly, the glider gained altitude noticeably.
'A- ah, got it! Over there, a thermal.'
Finding the heart, Kotori took the yoke and\nquickly tried to turn it.
'W-wha-whoa?!'
The glider pivoted and turned in a deep, banking\nangle.
As we turned sideways, we were assaulted with\nstrong g-force.
It felt as if all of our blood went to one side;\nWe could lose consciousness.
'(When you're not controlling the glider, the\nunpredictable g-force can be killer!)'
Remember that when you're flying.
'Hey! Be more gentle when you're turning!'
'Huh? Right. Sorry.'
Kotori loosened up on the yoke.
Gently banking the glider, the g-force became\nless aggressive.
'So, just now was bad...?'
'Let's look at the barometer.'
Even though the glider should be entering the\nthermal's heart, we were actually falling.

'When you bank deeply, you fall a lot more than
usual. While checking the strength of the core,
you should also try and find the perfect turning
radius.'
If the turning radius is small and the banking is\ndeep, the glider will lose altitude.
Furthermore, to re-ascend, you have to find a\nstrong thermal.
It's idea to banking somewhat deeply in the heart\nof a strong thermal. However there are\nlimitations.
When that's not possible, you need to bank more\nshallowly to avoid losing too much altitude.
'Meaning you have to play it by ear, right?'
'Yes, but making a sharp turn in the core of a\nthermal is stupid!'
Even if you're in the heart of a strong upwind,\nthe glider won't be carried upwards if you're\nbanking too hard.
Furthermore, the continuous g-force will quickly\nmake you lose consciousness.
'But I want to fly higher as quickly as\npossible.'
Kotori said this as if she really couldn't wait.
'Seriously... You are a daredevil, aren't you?\nRegardless, it was a good looking turn.'
'Really?'
Although we saw the yaw string, the glider was\nbarely gliding.
At first glance it wouldn't seem like it, but in\nreality it was a beautiful, perfectly balanced\nturn.
Altitude loss was also kept at a minimum.
'You don't have to rush. It's better to climb\nslowly.'
'OK!'
Kotori replied merrily, then banked appropriately\nto take the glider higher.
'They're flying around and round.'
'They caught a thermal.'
'Wow. They're that high? It's scary just looking\nat it.'
'They must be thrilled with this first flight...\nI wonder, can Aoi hear us at all?'
'What, Ageha?'
'Aren't you flying too high?'
'We found a great thermal. It's OK. We're\nfollowing it.'
'That's great, but- isn't Kotori being\nunreasonable?'
'Like I said, it's fine.'
'Ok. I understand.'
Kotori responded, concentrating on flying.
She was completely absorbed in riding the\nthermal.
I saw the scenery on the ground fading away and\nwas honestly surprised.
'(I have practically nothing left to teach.)'
At this point, she's got all the basic procedures\ndown practically perfectly.
To say she wasn't a quick learner would be a lie.
No matter how many times you use the simulator,\nit's not the sameas actually flying.
But Kotori quickly came to trust her intuition,\nand was able to find the unseen thermals and take\nthe glider higher.
Flying in a glider- No, the sense of flying in a\nglider might be the most amazing thing ever.
'...We've touched the sky.'
Kotori muttered while gazing out through the\ncanopy.
The glider steadily climbed higher.
This thermal is a good, strong one.
'There's quite a bit of cross wind right now, so\nwe should be careful.'
I explained as Kotori looked down.
'Wow...We are REALLY high up. The scenery from\nabove ground is hazy and almost surreal.'
'That's because we are twice as high up as Tokyo\nTower right now.'
Right now, our altitude is approximately 700\nmeters.
It was a good thermal, and it was Kotori's first\ntime at this height.
'Windmill Hill has a kind of circular shape,\ndoesn't it? Like a crescent moon.'
Windmill Hill is almost directly below us. At\nthis height, we had a nearly unbroken view.
The hill ran semi-circular alongside the lake.
'That shape stops the wind blowing across the\nsea. The force builds and runs up the hill,\ncausing the windmills to turn.'
The wind comes off the lake and stops where the\nhalf moon lake ends. When that happens the\ncollective strength of the wind runs up the hill.
The windmills were built there because of this\nphenomenon.
'This is amazing. The feeling of flying...'
Kotori sighed softly, taking in the moment.
'This is the feeling of freedom... And the my\nlegs, it's like I've forgotten all about them'
Flying in the air, she has no need for her legs.
Only in times like these does she truly seem to\nfeel free.
'I knew it.'
'It suits you to fly on your own, rather than to\nhave someone else fly for you.'
Kotori thought about it a little before\nanswering.
'Hmmm. That might be so.'
'My name is 'Kotori' right? For no particular\nreason, ever since I was young I have always\nwanted to fly. And now I really am...'
'Who would have thought, dreams can come true.'
'My name, well, my father named me.'

'His hobby was photography. He would often take
pictures of the sky. On the day I was born, the
skies were a bright blue, so he named me 'Aoi' or
so he says.'
'Really... So this place is like your hometown.'
'So, we're kinda the same.'
We both smile awkwardly after that embarrassing\nexchange.
Now that you mention it, there was a clear, blue\nsky on the day I heard how I got my name, too. It\nhad a special feel to it.
Well after that, I learned that the character for\nmy name 'Aoi' actually refers to a green-ish blue\ncolor; It kind of disappointed me.
'The feeling of being high in the heavens.\nConstantly flying around.'
Being in the glider, unbound by gravity, soaring\nin the sky created an odd feeling.
I saw Kotori's profile in the canopy as she gazed\nout and I thought she looked like a being from a\nfar away place.
'That was negligent. Don't forget to always pay\nattention to the conditions and atmospheric\npressure.'
'If you don't, you'll fall.'
'Understood.'
With a strong answer, Kotori gripped the yoke\nfirmly.
'We just finished cleaning up over here.'
'Good job, everyone. Let's call it a day.'
We flew until sunset, and then left the field.
Between maintenance and rest time, we got in 5\nflights.
'That was one really long flight today.'
'There certainly were some great thermals. Those\nwere the ideal soaring conditions.'
The best way to learn is to fly as much as\npossible.
Because the flying times are restricted, it's\nbest to be in the sky as long as possible.
Kotori certainly improved today. Even in her take\noff and landings.
'Kotori really is an amazing person. You can't\nsay that about everyone.'
Amane was quite happy with how things went today.
'It's all thanks to the cockpit that Amane\ndesigned for us.'
'I am glad it helped.'
'By the way, where did you go?'
'If you're talking about her, she left to\ndaydream rather than help clean up.'
Asa stepped out for a minute and told us.
'I just came to say that we're done for the day.'
'Ok.'
When we left our secret base Kotori stopped for a\nmoment to gaze at the evening sky.
'What were you doing?'
'My body felt like it started to shake. As if it\nwere still in the sky.'
This is the top of the hill. From here, if you\nlooked just right, it could seem like you were in\nthe air, flying.
'Even though this was your first flight, you got\na considerable amount of flying time in.'
Kotori looked up into the sky.
She seemed to yearn for the sky.
'What should I do? After today, nothing will be\nthe same again.'
'It's great to be able to experience such amazing\nthings, but I think my head will always be in the\nclouds now.'
I was just like that on the day of my first\nflight.
Just living with your feet on the ground felt\nannoying.
'It would be amazing if I could fly again... And\nagain... And again.'
'And with that goal in mind, I spent a whole year\npreparing.'
'Right.'
The sky was a daytime blue full of countless\ntwinkling stars.
Kotori's eyes shone like the stars as she gazed\nlovingly at the sky.
